assign.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing
assign.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I’ve been assigned the task of looking after the new students.
Jan’s been assigned to the Asian Affairs Bureau.
Madison was assigned to investigate a balloon accident.
assign.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to give a particular time, value, place etc to something
assign.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
A code was assigned to each batch of work.
assign.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to give money, equipment etc to someone to use
assign.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: A personal bodyguard had been assigned to her.
They assigned me a small room.
assign.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to give someone a particular job or task, or send them to work in a particular place or for a particular person
assign.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: His duties have now been assigned to the deputy chairman.
She was assigned to the US Embassy in Moscow.
He was assigned to work in a Chicago bank.
assign.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to give a particular amount of time, money, or resources to something
assign.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
assign.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to decide that something has a particular value or is of a particular quality
assign.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: the difficulty of assigning a value to an hour of housework
The group has been assigned a triple A rating by Standard and Poor’s.
assign.translation[1].definitions[3].def: to give something such as property to another person formally, by contract
assign.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: They only assign ownership when the house is complete.
